entry.title: Project Skywatch Captures First 360° Preview of Future Camera View
entry.summary: Project Skywatch has released a stunning 360° drone preview of our future mountaintop camera location, showcasing panoramic views and hinting at the capabilities of our 30× zoom PTZ system. Watch the full video and join us as we prepare for live streaming later this year!

entry.title: ROSEBURG RECEIVES 0.05 INCHES OF PRECIPITATION IN JULY
entry.summary: August 2, 2025 11:15 a.m. The Roseburg Regional Airport received just 0.05 inches of precipitation in July. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the normal amount of rain for the month is 0.26 inches. However, forecasters said it is not unusual for Roseburg to...

entry.title: FINAL UPDATE ON MILEPOST 124 FIRE ON MT. NEBO
entry.summary: August 1, 2205 4:30 p.m. The Milepost 124 Fire on Mt. Nebo is 75 percent mopped up, as of Friday afternoon. The final update on the fire from the Douglas Forest Protective Association said response to the fire began Thursday night at about 6:30 p.m. Crews from DFPA, Roseburg Fire Department, Central Douglas Fire &...

entry.title: UPTD's weekend busses to stop rolling next month amid funding concerns
entry.summary: Umpqua Public Transit District (UPTD) will suspend all weekend bus service starting Aug. 9, citing a breakdown in federal and state funding that transit officials say has left the district scrambling to avoid deeper cuts.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 8.1.25
entry.summary: Oregon House Republican Leader Christine Drazan in this encore program.

entry.title: Firefighters Continue to work on Containing Milepost 124 Fire on Mount Nebo
entry.summary: A rapidly spreading vegetation fire broke out at approximately 6:30 p.m. on July 31, 2025, near Milepost 124 on Interstate 5 southbound, affecting the hillside of Mount Nebo in Roseburg. Multiple agencies quickly mobilized, including crews from the Roseburg Fire Department, Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA), Central Douglas

entry.title: MILEPOST 124 MT. NEBO FIRE AT 50 ACRES AS MOP UP CONTINUES
entry.summary: August 1, 2025 11:30 a.m. The Milepost 124 Mt. Nebo Fire is listed at 50 acres as mop up continues. A joint release from the Douglas Forest Protective Association and the Roseburg Fire Department said at 6:30 p.m. Thursday, crews from both agencies along with Central Douglas Fire & Rescue, Roseburg Police Department, the Oregon...

entry.title: Mt. Nebo wildland fire 100% trailed, 40% mopped up
entry.summary: As of early Friday morning, the 50-acre Milepost 124 Fire on Mt. Nebo was 100% trailed and 40% mopped up, with mop-up efforts expected to continue through the weekend.

entry.title: Mount Nebo fire contained; drone interference posed danger to response
entry.summary: Firefighters and emergency crews swiftly responded to a wildfire near Interstate 5, Milepost 124 Southbound, on the evening of July 31.

entry.title: Which protective district do you fall in?
entry.summary: Wildfire season seems to come earlier and earlier each year, bringing with it a list of restrictions to activities that might lead to a potential fire.

entry.summary: There still is time for book lovers to earn prizes during Roseburg Public Library’s Summer Reading Program.

entry.title: Learn to use your telescope at August's Moon Watch event
entry.summary: August opens with Mars low in the west as twilight fades tonight. Look toward the horizon in the west at about 9 p.m. to spot a modest star. That’s Mars.

entry.title: The Peanut Butter tree: A fun tree for any landscape
entry.summary: Question: When visiting the Splash Pad at Fir Grove in Roseburg I noticed a beautiful tree that had a strong fragrance of peanut butter. Can you tell me more about this lovely tree?

entry.summary: Mary Gilbert of the Mary Gilbert Group at Keller Williams Southern Oregon has our weekly local look at real estate.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 8.1.25
entry.summary: Carey Rayburn of Good Co talks about the band’s unique jazzy sound and their concert at Riverbend Live! Friday night.

entry.title: Dome Spe, FARA's youth shelter, is open
entry.summary: Dome Spe, an emergency and transitional shelter for homeless youth aged 12-17, soft-launched its opening Monday. The shelter, spearheaded by Family, Faith and Relationship Advocates (FARA), acts as a resource for youth without stable housing.

entry.title: Rep. Val Hoyle in Oregon tracking federal policy at state level
entry.summary: U.S. Rep. Val Hoyle (D-Ore.) is back from Washington D.C. and traveling through Oregon’s 4th Congressional District — which includes Benton, Coos, Curry, Lane, Lincoln and northern Douglas counties — for the next four weeks to “touch base” with constituents…

entry.title: Overnight stormwater project to start Monday
entry.summary: An overnight stormwater improvement project on four blocks of West Harvard Avenue will begin Monday.

entry.title: Firefighters respond to structure fire off Del Rio Road
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Central Douglas Fire & Rescue responded to a structure fire on Brozio Road, off Del Rio Road, at 5:25 Thursday. Initial reports said a house was fully engulfed and the fire was spreading to surrounding vegetation.

entry.title: Several fires reported in Umpqua National Forest
entry.summary: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST — USDA Forest Service firefighters are responding to several reports of new fires following thunderstorms over the Cascade Range over the last several days.

entry.title: Summer meal distribution continues in Winston-Dillard
entry.summary: WINSTON — The Winston-Dillard School District has its summer meal distribution underway.

entry.title: Mt. Nebo Wildland Fire Scorches Four Acres; Drone Use Grounds Aerial Response
entry.summary: An estimated four-acre wildland fire ignited on Mt. Nebo near I-5 milepost 124 at 6:30 p.m. Thursday. DFPA, Roseburg Fire, and Central Douglas crews attacked by ground and air until drone interference grounded aircraft. By 9:57 p.m., 50% of the perimeter was trailed.

entry.title: WINSTON-DILLARD SCHOOL DISTRICT SUMMER MEALS THROUGH MID-AUGUST
entry.summary: August 1, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Winston-Dillard School District continues its summer meal distribution program until the middle of this month. entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 7.31.25
entry.summary: Douglas County Fairgrounds Complex Director Ciera Keith has a preview of this year’s fair, which begins next Wednesday.

entry.title: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza in Roseburg Closing Permanently
entry.summary: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza in Roseburg closes permanently Thursday due to low revenue. Manager Charles Crosier informed customers via Facebook, lamenting the loss of the restaurant's community connections. Staff are already seeking new employment.

entry.title: FEDERAL DISASTER RELIEF COMING TO SOUTHERN OREGON, BUT SOME DENIED
entry.summary: July 31, 2025 11:10 a.m. Some federal disaster relief is coming to southern Oregon, but two requests have been denied by the federal government. Oregon’s U.S. Senators Jeff Merkley and Ron Wyden and U.S. Representative Val Hoyle have welcomed the approval of Oregon Governor Tina Kotek’s request for a Major Disaster Declaration from the Federal...

entry.title: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park reopens after flood repairs
entry.summary: Roseburg's Happy Tails Dog Park is set to reopen on Friday, Aug. 1, after undergoing significant repairs due to flood damage. According to Roseburg Parks and Recreation, the park will be ready by the end of the workday.

entry.title: Heat up summer with Zumba in the Park
entry.summary: To get outdoors and open Zumba classes up to the public, the YMCA’s Wednesday evening class moves to Stewart Park during the summer.

entry.title: New city portal launches Aug. 1
entry.summary: A partnership between the city of Roseburg and OpenGov.com will bring a new online portal option to Roseburg residents.

entry.title: RED FLAG WARNING RESUMES THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS
entry.summary: July 31, 2025 4:10 a.m. A Red Flag Warning is in effect for portions of the Southern Oregon Cascades and surrounding areas from 2:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. Thursday for abundant lightning on dry fuels. An Urgent Fire Message from the National Weather Service said this will result in the potential for new fire starts....

entry.title: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza closes Thursday
entry.summary: Clubhouse by Round Table Pizza, located on Stewart Parkway in Roseburg, will be closing Thursday for good.

entry.title: Don’s Mid Town Grill and its former employees endure financial hardship
entry.summary: In June, Don’s Mid Town Grill announced it was closing its Winston location following months of economic hardship that radiated beyond the restaurant.

entry.title: Umpqua River Lighthouse, Museum and Gift Shop receive Tripadvisor award
entry.summary: WINCHESTER BAY — The Umpqua River Lighthouse, Museum and Gift Shop has been recognized as one of the world's best destinations. Douglas County commissioners announced Thursday that the museum has received a Tripadvisor Travelers' Choice Award for 2025.

entry.title: Douglas County Fair begins in one week
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The 2025 Douglas County Fair begins in one week.

entry.title: Senate Bill 95 brings new judge to Douglas County
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — On July 24, Gov. Kotek signed Senate Bill 95 into law. The legislation creates new judicial positions for Douglas, Lane and Clackamas counties.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued for Umpqua Basin
entry.summary: DOUGLAS COUNTY — A Fire Weather Watch is in place for the Umpqua Basin from Wednesday evening through Thursday morning for abundant lightning on dry fuels.

entry.title: Community shows up for Breabach at the half shell
entry.summary: The hill in Stewart Park was covered in people as the Douglas County community listened, danced or swayed to the Scottish band Breabach on Tuesday during Music on the Half Shell.

entry.title: Flowers and food: Local businesses transition to new storefronts
entry.summary: In Douglas County, two businesses are adjusting to new business models, with one increasing in size and the other scaling back. Here’s what to know about what’s changing for Roseburg-based The Soup and Salad Shop and Sutherlin-based Country Flowers:

entry.title: Douglas County outreach programs aim to build rural resilience
entry.summary: Douglas County’s Emergency Management Department is aiming to help its hardest to reach residents with two additions to its Rural Outreach Programs, according to a July 23 Douglas County Board of Commissioners press release.

entry.title: Loans available for homes, businesses, nonprofits, renters affected by March floods
entry.summary: The United States Small Business Administration (SBA) is in Roseburg offering loans for residences — including rentals — businesses and nonprofit organizations in Coos, Curry and Douglas counties affected by floods March 12-20.

entry.title: Wizards, snakes and all things fantastic show up to Roseburg Public Library
entry.summary: Ashton Olson handed out items to create keys for children at Roseburg Public Library on Saturday morning during the annual Harry Potter Day.
